about.bugReport: File a bug report or request a feature:
about.description1: TMI (Threat Modeling Improved) is a collaborative platform for creating, managing, and sharing threat models. Our mission is to make security threat modeling accessible, efficient, and integrated into the software development lifecycle.
about.description2: The platform features interactive diagram creation with real-time collaboration, and comprehensive threat documentation capabilities. Built with modern web technologies, TMI helps teams identify, analyze, and mitigate security threats through collaborative modeling.

opensource.paragraph1-intro: This application is built with the support of exceptional open-source projects. We're grateful to the communities behind
opensource.paragraph1-outro: for their outstanding tools and resources that bring our interface and functionality to life.
opensource.paragraph2-intro: A special thanks goes to the
opensource.paragraph2-outro: open-source project for providing inspiration that helped shape our vision and approach to building a secure and user-friendly application.

about.title: About TMI

embedding.cannotEmbedTextBox: Text boxes cannot be embedded into other shapes
embedding.securityBoundaryRestriction: Security boundaries can only be embedded into other security boundaries

homeDescription: A collaborative threat modeling tool designed to help teams identify, analyze, and document security threats in their systems. Create, share, and collaboratively edit threat models and diagrams to improve your application security.
homeWelcomeTitle: Welcome to TMI: Threat Modeling Improved

local.emailInvalid: Please enter a valid email address

privacy.changesContent: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. Any changes will be posted on this page with an updated "Last Updated" date.
privacy.complianceContent: We will only disclose information if required to do so by law, such as in response to a valid government order or subpoena. In such cases, The Operator will comply with applicable legal obligations.

contactContent.part1: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please feel free to contact the Operator of this web site via the contact information on the

privacy.dataContent: The web site uses OpenID Connect for sign-in and OAuth for access control, storing only your user ID, email, and name from the provider for login and display purposes.
privacy.dataContent2: Your threat models are stored by the server until you delete them and may be used to enhance our service.
privacy.dataContent3: We keep logs only as long as needed for support and operations, then delete them automatically.
privacy.dataContent4: Your data stays private- we do not sell or share it with anyone, except as required by law.

intro1.part1: This web site is an instance of an open-source web application ("TMI") that is made available by the Operator listed on the
intro1.part2: page of this web site ("The Operator").

privacy.intro2: We are committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how your information is handled.
privacy.title: Privacy Policy

intro.part2: page of this web site ("The Operator").

Unless stated otherwise, the Operator of this web site is not affiliated with the TMI project or its creators.
